byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS, JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and JONATHAN SOBLE
byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris and Julie Hirschfeld Davis reported from Washington, and Jonathan Soble from Tokyo.

abstract: Pres Obama is set to visit Hiroshima, Japan, becoming first American president to visit site of World War II atomic bombing; visit stands to highlight transformed relations between countries and shared goal of nuclear disarmament, but also to open old wounds; both sides give no indication that American apology is expected.
snippet: The visit carries weighty symbolism for the president, who does not want to be seen as apologizing for America’s use of atomic bombs to help end World War II....
lead_paragraph: The visit carries weighty symbolism for the president, who does not want to be seen as apologizing for America’s use of atomic bombs to help end World War II.

headline.main: Obama to Be First Sitting President to Visit Hiroshima
headline.print_headline: Obama to Be First Sitting President to Visit Hiroshima
